com.bergerkiller.bukkit.common.filtering

Class FilterBundle<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bergerkiller.bukkit.common.filtering.FilterBundle<E>
  • Type Parameters:
    E - - Element type
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Filter<E>

    public class FilterBundle<E>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Filter<E>
    A bundle of Filters. If any of the Filters contained in a bundle filter an element, the isFiltered(Object) method will return False. This can be used for multiple conditional filtering requirements.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FilterBundle()
      Constructs a new empty Filter Bundle.
      FilterBundle(java.util.Collection<Filter<?>> filters)
      Constructs a new Filter Bundle using the filters specified.
      FilterBundle(Filter<?>... filters)
      Constructs a new Filter Bundle using the filters specified.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FilterBundle

        public FilterBundle()
        Constructs a new empty Filter Bundle. You can add filters using the addFilter(Filter) method.

      • FilterBundle

        public FilterBundle(Filter<?>... filters)
        Constructs a new Filter Bundle using the filters specified. The Filter element types can not be checked, so be sure to only construct a Filter Bundle using Filters that can accept the element type of this filter.
        Parameters:
        filters - to create a bundle for

      • FilterBundle

        public FilterBundle(java.util.Collection<Filter<?>> filters)
        Constructs a new Filter Bundle using the filters specified. The Filter element types can not be checked, so be sure to only construct a Filter Bundle using Filters that can accept the element type of this filter.
        Parameters:
        filters - to create a bundle for

    • Method Detail

      • addFilter

        public void addFilter(Filter<?> filter)
        Adds a Filter to this Filter Bundle. The Filter element types can not be checked, so be sure to only construct a Filter Bundle using Filters that can accept the element type of this filter.
        Parameters:
        filter - to add

      • removeFilter

        public void removeFilter(Filter<?> filter)
        Removes a Filter from this Filter Bundle.
        Parameters:
        filter - to remove

      • getFilters

        public java.util.Collection<Filter<E>> getFilters()
        Gets a Collection of all the Filters used by this Filter Bundle. The returned Collection is unmodifiable.
        Returns:
        Collection of filters

      • isFiltered

        public boolean isFiltered(E element)
        Description copied from interface: Filter
        Gets whether an element is filtered by this Filter or not
        Specified by:
        isFiltered in interface Filter<E>
        Parameters:
        element - to check
        Returns:
        True if the element is filtered, False if not
